Name: Arrowwood Park
Description: Arrowwood Park provides areas for children to participate in unstructured play along the creek and in the sandbox at the playground. Small playground. Trail.

Name: Beach Park
Description: Cute playground for younger kids.

Name: Bear Creek Park
Description: With walking paths adjacent to Bear Creek, children are able to observe wildlife and a natural aquatic habitat on the buffers of Bear Creek Park.

Name: Boulder Elks Pool
Description: Outdoor pool with lap lanes, diving boards, snack bar, friendly staff, “adult swim” breaks & BBQs

Name: Boulder Museum of Contemporary Art
Description: An engaging contemporary art space offering rotating exhibits, artist talks, and educational workshops. Specific programs for toddlers include the BMoCA Art Stop, an art-making workshop for ages 2-5.

Name: Boulder Public Library
Description: Public library with extensive family programs—storytimes, STEAM activities, Makerspace, teen events, and year-round community events. Kids toys near kids books. Games. Plenty of space for crawling.

Name: Boulder Reservoir Swim Beach
Description: Family-friendly lifeguarded swim beach with restrooms, showers, lockers, and general changing facilities on the south side of the Visitor Services Center; includes floating platforms, picnic sites, boat rentals, and adjacent playground/play space

Name: Boulder Swim Club
Address: Boulder Swim Club 555 30th St. Boulder, CO 80303

Name: Butterfly Pavilion
Description: A zoological non-profit specializing in invertebrates with immersive exhibits such as the tropical rainforest “Wings of the Tropics” with hundreds of free‑flying butterflies, “Crawl‑A‑See‑Em” for tarantulas and scorpions, “Water’s Edge” tidal touch exhibit, plus the Colorado Backyard indoor play area, outdoor Nature Trail, and Discovery Garden—hands-on, interactive, and educational for families.

Name: Center for Musical Arts
Description: Offers early childhood music education. Classes for infants, toddlers, and preschool-aged children and their caregivers

Name: Cottonwood Park
Address: Via Appia & South Boulder Rd, Louisville, CO 80027
Description: A pleasant neighborhood park featuring a playground, zip-line, huge slides, picnic areas, basketball court, multi‐purpose field, and paved trails with shelter options—ideal for casual outdoor play and family time.

Name: Denver Botanic Gardens – Mordecai Children’s Garden
Description: Mordecai Children’s Garden is a place for children and families to explore plants and the natural world, through hands­-on experiences and play. A variety of authentic natural materials in this garden allow kids to use their imagination and sense of wonder to create their own connections with plants. Included with admission to the Gardens.

Name: East Boulder Community Park
Description: East Boulder Community Park is located adjacent to East Boulder Community Center and Keewaydin Meadows Park. It offers several unique recreational areas including a dog park, a pond, turf fields, and sand volleyball courts, along with a variety of additional areas. Play area includes sand, toddler area, toddler-friendly older kids playground, climbable sculptures.

Name: Flagstaff Nature Center
Description: The center is a great place to familiarize yourself with the wildlife, plants, wildflowers and other flora, and history of Open Space and Mountain Parks. Interactive activities and games at the center will challenge the child in all of us. Many stuffed animal mounts will show you who lives in the forests and grasslands about you. There are also displays and activities that teach about the geology and about open space management. A kid’s corner provides activities and books for the youngest members of our community to enjoy.

Name: Foothills Community Park
Description: 65.2-acre park offering a playground, soccer field, dog area, basketball, hockey rinks & trails.

Name: GroundWorks Art Lab
Description: Classes for youth 4+

Name: Growing Gardens – Children’s Peace Garden / Sprout! Parent & Tot
Address:
Growing Gardens
1630 Hawthorn Avenue
Boulder, CO 80304
Website: Growing Gardens – Children’s Peace Garden / Sprout! Parent & Tot
Description: Join us on the farm for classes for the whole family! Take a deep dive learning about different environmental topics that are engaging and offer a hands on learning experience. Classes are geared for kids ages 5+ with attendance of an adult.

Name: Haertling Sculpture Garden
Description:
The park displays Jerry Wingren's "Double Arc," Dennis Yoshikawa wright's "Correspondence," Tom Miller's "Chief Niwot," and "Circus Fish" by Beth Juliar-Skodje.
Online reviews indicate there may be encampments here frequently. Possible pitstop while walking/biking on the path.

Name: Harlow Platts Community Park
Description: Playground with shade structures, walking path, picnic tables, disc golf. Playground equipment includes sand area, infant/toddler play set, preschool/kindergarten play set, swings

Name: Howard Heuston Park
Description: Local park with a dog area, playground, sports facilities & paved walking paths. Playground equipment geared towards older kids. Has a skate park.

Name: Martin Park
Description: Neighborhood park with a creek, 2 playgrounds & a picnic shelter, plus tennis courts & ball fields.

Name: Mountain Song Music Studio
Description: Offers specialized music programs for young children

Name: Museum of Boulder (Playzeum)
Description: Features Playzeum, Boulder's children's museum space for self-guided exploration and experimentation

Name: Music Together of Boulder
Description:
- Weekly classes for children ages 0-6 and their caregivers
- Located at 1410 Quince Ave
- Offers playful, inclusive family activities for babies, toddlers, and preschoolers

Name: My Nature Lab
Address:
1100 Pine Street, Unit B
Louisville, CO 80027
Description:
My Nature Lab is your place for creative learning and exploration of nature through unique and one of a kind experiences. During Open Lab, our educators are always teaching you about these animals through hands-on learning. Come meet Bob the Bearded Dragon, hold a snake, or feed Tabasco the green iguana - every experience is different and unique but we promise to teach you something new with every visit.

Looking to see a snake eat?
Join us during Open Lab every Friday for Feeding Friday! This weekly event is your chance to learn all about the unique way that each of these animals eats, including the chance to feed many of them yourself. Feeding Friday happens every Friday, and animals are fed non-stop while we are open.

Name: Nature Detectives Kids Club
Description:
Join the club by participating in self-guided tours and activities. Each Mystery Guide takes you on an exploration of a specific open space property. Kids do not need any special knowledge or equipment – just curious minds and a sense of adventure.
Each guide features:
- Activities that highlight the natural surroundings and history of each location.
- Map.
- Four to six mysteries to solve.

Name: NCAR Mesa Lab Visitor Center
Description:
interactive exhibits on weather & climate; open to the public.
An ADA-compliant single-stall restroom with a changing table is located on the north end of the 2nd floor

Name: North Boulder Park
Description: A versatile, well-maintained community park offering a wide range of outdoor recreational amenities—playground, sports courts and fields, tot biking track, fitness equipment, picnic shelters with grills, restrooms, and scenic green spaces. Great for families, community gatherings, and active play.

Name: Pearl Street Mall
Description:
Areas of interest for toddler:
- Splash pad
- Climbing rocks
- Tebu train

Name: Sandstone Ranch Visitors & Learning Center
Description:
A variety of nature-focused, educational and artistic events/classes are happening at the Sandstone Ranch Visitors & Learning Center. There is fun for all ages, and many programs are free!

Hours are seasonal: Wednesdays: May through August; 2nd & 4th Saturdays: March through October

Name: Scott Carpenter Park
Description:
Scott Carpenter Park and Pool is largely aimed toward programmed and structured recreational activity. Despite this design, children often play along the buffers of the park and on the playground, which contains crater and rock play structures, which emulate features found in nature.

The playground features a toddler area. The rest of the equipment is pretty advanced and better for preschool+ ages.
Sledding in winter.

Name: The Little Gym
Address: 1355 E South Boulder Rd, Louisville, Colorado 80027
Description: The Little Gym is the place where children ages 4 months to 12 years learn and grow through movement-based learning and imaginative play. Our gyms are safe spaces for both children and parents to not only explore gymnastics, but so much more. At The Little Gym, children build the confidence and skills needed at each stage of childhood while parents enjoy a supportive and positive community. Everyone has Serious Fun!

Name: Tinker Art Studio
Description: “Tinker Time” process-art classes for ages 2–5

Name: University of Colorado Museum of Natural History
Description: The CU Museum is closed until January 8, 2026

Name: Walden Ponds Wildlife Habitat
Description: easy paths, lots of birds; good for simple “seek & find” walks.

Name: Wild Bear Nature Center
Description: free outdoor storytime for ages 0–5; nature-focused youth programs.

Name: Wonderland Lake Park
Description: Lakeside neighborhood park with a playground, picnic facilities & loop trail with views.

Name: WOW! Children's Museum
Description: Offers art, science, and dramatic play exhibits

Name: Tom Watson Park
Description: Recreation venue featuring baseball fields, basketball & tennis courts & a kids' playground.

Name: Shanahan Ridge Park
Description: This neighborhood park is located along the Skip bus route and close to the Open Space and Mountain Parks hiking trails in the area. Playground is set up for 'natural' play i.e. climbing through a tunnel or up a rock.
